channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023110065
item.description:
Report X-2023110065

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: OOLTEWAH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unable to determine the sequence of events due to lack of communication with the shift when the damage occurred. DescribePack: There is a dent on the side and on the lid which created separation between the lid and the body of the pail. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged pail was placed in a bin and taken to a QA station where it was taken to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023101374
item.description:
Report X-2023101374

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: OOLTEWAH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unable to determine sequence of events due to lack of communication with previous sort. DescribePack: Box became wet on top and sides due to a loose cap that caused one of the bottles to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bucket to prevent further leakage and was taken to a QA station out of the way of other workers.

item.title: Report X-2023101337
item.description:
Report X-2023101337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND LEAKING DURRING VAN LOAD. TOP OF BOX WAS WET FROM INNER LEAKAGE. THE OUTER PACKING WAS SIZED FOR 4 BOTTLES ONLY TWO WERE HOUSED WITHIN. CARDBOARD DIVIDERS WERE USED AS WELL AS PAPER PACKING TO TRY AND SUPPORT THE TWO BOTTLES. DescribePack: ONE OF THE BOTTLES WAS MISSING A CAP. CAP WAS FOUND IN THE ZIP LOCK BAG BOTTLE WAS SET IN. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED TO HAZMAT TOTE AND PLACED IN CAGE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found at 600 line wet from open and leaking gallon of low voc primer. Package was taken to HAZMAT cage to isolate and await processing. DescribePack: Can of primer leaked at the lid that had opened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was notified of issue who then took package to the HAZMAT cage to isolate and await processing

item.title: Report X-2023101297
item.description:
Report X-2023101297

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found load side where a strong smell was coming from the box. QA was contacted to come look at it where it was found that the seal on the lid of the bottle had broken allowing liquid to spill out. Package was taken to QA to isolate and await processing DescribePack: spill occurred at the lid where the plastic seal around the lid broke allowing lid to come off and liquid to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was taken to QA to isolate and await processing

item.title: Report X-2023101226
item.description:
Report X-2023101226

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/7/2023 at approximately 0330, Dangerous Goods Administration recieved a call from Employee 292350 at the hub facilty in Memphis, reporting an aerosol spill. The shipment consisted of 3 overpacked pallets with multiple dangerous goods shipments that originated in the United Kingdom. The pallets did not clear customs and were set to be returned to the origin location. One of the pallet, ending in -9260 was held due to one of the pacakges falling from under the wrapping. The fallen package sustained damage, due to human error, and is unable to complete transport. The remainder of the pallet is being held, pending the receipt of an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023101135
item.description:
Report X-2023101135

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Oct 6th, a box was discovered during the PM sort leaking and a slight smell. upon investigating the package it contained UN1266 Perfumery Products, 3, PGII. Out of the 40 bottles inside, 8 broke. It is unknown how the damage occured. The package was placed into a salvage drum and an amended shippers declaration was requested from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023101071
item.description:
Report X-2023101071

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking declared hazmat in fiberboard box found in zip-tied bag within tote on HMPA staging pallet. Prior events unclear but all spillage contained within/on box. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 2oz of fluid due to internal corrosion. Cap was secured tightly but the safety seal underneath cap and cap underside were discolored and loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote + sealed hazbag used to contain spillage and transport from operations to HMPA work area.

item.title: Report X-2023101066
item.description:
Report X-2023101066

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The punctured drum was left in a lined tote at the HWPA. No other information is known. DescribePack: There is a puncture in the top of the drum, near the cap. There is also a large dent in the side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was placed in a lined tote and brought to the HWSA. Since the puncture was on the top of the drum, very little liquid leaked.

item.title: Report X-2023100944
item.description:
Report X-2023100944

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat in leaking fiberboard box found on APA chute (intercept/discharge from mezzanine) and brought to HMPA staging pallet. Unclear whether package came down damaged and whether it was in tote upon discharge from mezzanine. Spidr images from the overhead scan tunnels taken prior to discovery do not reflect damage in sortation. DescribePack: One of the two 2.5 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.2 gallons of fluid from a 1.2" crack on the bottom of the handle body (not following seam). Improper handling; overhead scans on mezzanine. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned. Package found with spillage in lined and lidded red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100941
item.description:
Report X-2023100941

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pile of Ecolab hazmat packages found 5:30pm on Trailer 954036 from 755 MESQ on Door 82 of the small unload. Plastic 5 gallon drum of Ecolab Built Detergent was found upside down and when placed upright it was discovered lid seal was leaking. The package was placed in a lined red tote and removed from operations posthaste. DescribePack: Lid seal consistently leaking on all sides of the packaging. The drum was found upside down, suggesting internal corrosion of the inner seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned. Package and spillage were placed in a lined and lidded red tote for transport to the HMPA. Care was taken to separate this hazmat from another leaking hazmat of Sodium hypochlorite solution within the same trailer.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND SIDEWAYS ON ROLLERS AT SWAK IN A BLACK TOTE - TOP OF BOX WAS DISINGRATED. PACKAGE UPRIGHTED AND MOVED TO TOTE DescribePack: LEAKING APPEARED TO BE COMING FROM THE CAP - ALL CAPS ON SECURLY DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE UPRIGHTED, PLACED IN RED HAZMATE TOTE AND MOVED TO CAGE UNDER THE HOOD.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND IN TOTE UNDER THE ROLLERS IN BLACK TOTE. OUTER PACKING WAS WET AT THE TOP AND DOWN THE SIDE. DescribePack: LEAKAGE FROM 2 BOTTLES AT THE CAP - NO LOOSE CAPS FOUND. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED UPRIGHT IN HAZMAT TOTE AND MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE UNDER VENT.

item.title: Report X-2023100791
item.description:
Report X-2023100791

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of release during sort operations at the Memphis Hub. The fiberboard box contained four plastic 1 gallon containers. The cap on one of the plastic containers was loose causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed inside of a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
